item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: David Ortiz of Boston Red Sox apologizes, says he never used or bought steroids
item.description: Just because a player was on the list of names seized by the government doesn't guarantee he tested positive for steroids, the players' association says.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Cleveland Cavaliers' LeBron James unlikely to accept contract extension
item.description: LeBron James is unlikely to accept a contract extension from the Cleveland Cavaliers until after the 2009-10 season, when he can become a free agent.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Michael Vick meets with youth in event arranged by Humane Society
item.description: Michael Vick has arrived at a suburban Atlanta community center where he was scheduled to discuss how to deal with potentially violent dogs with inner-city youth.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Milwaukee Brewers' Prince Fielder acknowledges 'better ways of handling' being hit by Guillermo Mota pitch
item.description: Brewers first baseman Prince Fielder expressed subtle regret Friday over his actions earlier this week after being hit by a pitch in the ninth inning of a game against the Los Angeles Dodgers.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Dallas Cowboys cornerback Michael Jenkins injures ankle during practice
item.description: Dallas Cowboys cornerback Michael Jenkins has been carted off the practice field with an injury to his lower right leg.

item.dc:creator: External
item.title: In progress: Tiger among pack chasing Paddy

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Former coworker says accuser bragged about being with Ben Roethlisberger
item.description: The lawyer for a woman suing quarterback Ben Roethlisberger for alleged sexual assault has given the two-time Super Bowl winner more time to respond to the lawsuit.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Cleveland Browns release defensive lineman Shaun Smith
item.description: The Cleveland Browns have released veteran defensive lineman Shaun Smith.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Minnesota Vikings QB Tarvaris Jackson comes up gimpy after appearing to aggravate left knee
item.description: Minnesota Vikings quarterback Tarvaris Jackson appeared to aggravate a knee injury on Friday that caused him to miss three days of practice earlier in the week.

item.dc:creator: External
item.title: Beckham still interested in owning an MLS team
item.description: David Beckham has an option in his deal with MLS to own a team once playing days are over. He's still interested in that possibility.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Jimmie Johnson edges Kurt Busch for Watkins Glen International pole
item.description: Jimmie Johnson has won the Sprint Cup pole at Watkins Glen International.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Florida Gators top USA Today coaches' preseason poll
item.description: Defending national champion Florida tops the USA Today preseason football coaches' poll, receiving 53 of 59 first-place votes.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Back benches Zambrano as Rockies rip Marshall
item.description: The Colorado Rockies took advantage of the late scratch of Chicago Cubs starter Carlos Zambrano for a 6-3 victory Friday night.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: A-bomb: A-Rod HR tops BoSox in 15-inning epic
item.description: Alex Rodriguez broke up an electric pitchers' duel in the 15th inning with his first homer in three weeks, giving the New York Yankees a 2-0 victory over the Boston Red Sox on Friday night.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Rangers hit five home runs to pick apart Angels
item.description: Omar Vizquel drove in three runs with four hits, including one of Texas' five homers, and Josh Hamilton hit an early three-run shot in the second-place Rangers' 11-6 victory over the AL West-leading Los Angeles Angels on Friday night.
